definitions.definition: in a way that you would expect

examples.text: Naturally, I get upset when things go wrong.
After a while, we naturally started talking about the children.
It was late, so naturally her mother was worried.
We heard a loud crash, so naturally we went outside to investigate.

definitions.definition: without special help, treatment or action by somebody

examples.text: plants that grow naturally in poor soils
The enzyme is naturally present in garlic.

definitions.definition: as a normal, logical result of something

examples.text: This leads naturally to my next point.
The topic arose naturally in the conversation.

definitions.definition: in a way that shows or uses abilities or qualities that a person or an animal is born with

examples.text: She was naturally gifted when it came to music.

definitions.definition: in a relaxed and normal way
if something comes naturally to you, you are able to do it very easily and very well

examples.text: Making money came naturally to him.
We were simply doing what came naturally.
